perturbation.original_text: By this Agreement the Participants enter into a general Joint Venture (the "Joint Venture") in accordance with the laws of The State of Florida. The rights and obligations of the JVP will be as stated in the applicable legislation of The State of Florida except as otherwise provided in this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: By this Agreement the Participants enter into a specific Joint Venture (the "Joint Venture") in accordance with the laws of The State of Florida. The rights and obligations of the JVP will be determined exclusively by the terms of this Agreement, notwithstanding any conflicting legislation in The State of Florida.
perturbation.explanation: The modification changes 'general' to 'specific' joint venture, implying it's governed solely by the contract, conflicting with Florida law which regulates all joint ventures. The original text acknowledges Florida law while the changed text attempts to supersede it.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Florida Partnership Law, Chapter 620, which governs joint ventures and partnerships.

perturbation.original_text: The purpose of the Joint Venture will be: Manufacturing and Selling Health Related products.
perturbation.changed_text: The purpose of the Joint Venture will be: Potentially Manufacturing and Selling Health Related products, subject to future agreements.
perturbation.explanation: By adding 'Potentially' and 'subject to future agreements,' the purpose becomes vague. This creates uncertainty. Under Florida contract law, clear purpose are required.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Florida Contract Law, requiring definiteness of terms.

perturbation.original_text:
Force Majeure

A Participant will be free of liability to the Joint Venture where the Participant is prevented from executing their obligations under this Agreement in whole or in part due to force majeure, such as earthquake, typhoon, flood, fire, and war or any other unforeseen and uncontrollable event where the Participant has communicated the circumstance of said event to any and all other Participants and taken any and all appropriate action to mitigate said event.
perturbation.changed_text:
Force Majeure

A Participant will be free of liability to the Joint Venture where the Participant is prevented from executing their obligations under this Agreement in whole or in part due to force majeure, at the Participant's sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the examples of force majeure and the requirement to communicate the event and mitigate it, it gives the participant sole discretion, conflicting with the standard legal definition that requires events to be unforeseen, uncontrollable, and external. It creates uncertainty regarding when force majeure applies.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Common Law definition of Force Majeure.
